Home → New in and suggestions → Staff Picks → Advent calendar 2016

Suffolk Libraries advent calendar 2016

Every day until Christmas Eve a member of Suffolk Libraries reveals a book, album or film they'll be giving as a Christmas present, and why.

January 5

New fiction for January 2014

Featuring John-Henri Holmberg, Peter May and Louise Mensch.

January 27

Lesley’s Readers: Mad about the Boy by Helen Fielding

Helen Fielding's eponymous heroine tumbles through the challenges of single-motherhood, tweeting and texting.

February 5

New fiction for February 2014

Featuring Elly Griffiths and Joanna Trollope.

February 28

Lesleyâ€™s Readers: The twins by Saskia Sarginson

A tale of childhood secrets and the bond between twins.

February 28

New fiction for March 2014

Featuring Lynne Truss and Val McDermid.

March 7

Bailey’s Women’s Prize for Fiction 2014

This year's longlist includes 6 debuts as well as novels from superstar authors.

March 31

New fiction for April 2014

Featuring John Connolly and Sophie Hannah.

April 3

Lesley’s Readers: My dear I wanted to tell you by Louisa Young

A World War I story of a letter between two lovers and a terrible lie.

April 28

New fiction for May 2014

Featuring Sadie Jones, Louisa Young and Colm Toibin.

May 9

Lesley’s Readers: Doctor Sleep by Stephen King

In the sequel to The Shining, find out what happened to the little boy on the tricycle, Danny Torrance!

May 12

Lesley’s Readers: The fault in our stars by John Green

Bestselling book about teenage cancer patients.

May 13

Summer Reads: 8 new and challenging texts for 2014

A collection of 8 new novels, poetry collections and short story anthologies, specially chosen to get you out of your comfort zone and reading different literature and authors.

May 29

New fiction for June 2014

Featuring Robert Galbraith, Peter James and Terry Pratchett.

June 2

Lesley’s Readers: Elizabeth is missing by Emma Healey

Maud is losing her memory and figuring out why her friend has gone missing.

June 30

Lesley’s Readers: The Rosie project by Graeme Simsion

A light-hearted look at living with autism.

June 30

New fiction for July 2014

Featuring Peter Robinson, Graham Swift and Sheila O'Flanagan.

July 30

New fiction for August 2014

Featuring Lee Child and Ruth Rendell.

July 31

Lesley’s Readers: The hundred-foot journey by Richard C Morais

International bestseller about an Indian restaurant in rural France.

August 21

New fiction for September 2014

Featuring David Mitchell, Hilary Mantel and Susan Hill.

August 30

Lesley’s Readers: The silkworm by Robert Galbraith

Detective novel under J. K. Rowling's pseudonym, Robert Galbraith.

October 2

New fiction for October 2014

Featuring Rachel Joyce, Ian Rankin and Bernard Cornwell.

October 30

Lesley’s Readers: Before I go to sleep by S J Watson

Thriller about a woman with amnesia.

November 1

New fiction for November 2014

Featuring Nick Hornby, Peter James and Elly Griffiths.

November 3

Lesleyâ€™s Readers: We are all completely beside ourselves by Karen Joy Fowler

The book with the big twist.
